timeline.bodyText: Will we have OSGi bundle for ANC? I thought that new/optional modules will not be OSGi bundle. But if it's intentional, of course, it's fine.

replies.bodyText: Yes you're right, I removed this
replies.author: lucamolteni

replies.bodyText: After checking again, it seems like I put the OSGi bundle also in drools-traits (albeit with wrong package, will fix) and @mariofusco did the same in drools-mvel so let's put it in here for uniformity
replies.author: lucamolteni

replies.bodyText: @lucamolteni drools-mvel and drools-serialization-protobuf are OSGi compatible (they have to be otherwise I'd broke all existing OSGi usages). I agree that both this module and the traits one shouldn't support OSGi (at least for now) so using the bundle packaging here is at least misleading, if not wrong. I suggest to remove it.
replies.author: mariofusco

@@ -0,0 +1,130 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+  <parent>
+    <artifactId>drools</artifactId>
+    <groupId>org.drools</groupId>
+    <version>7.45.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+  </parent>
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+  <artifactId>drools-alphanetwork-compiler</artifactId>
+
+  <packaging>bundle</packaging><!-- bundle = jar + OSGi metadata -->
+
+  <name>Drools :: Alpha Network Compiler</name>
+
+  <properties>
+    <java.module.name>org.drools.core.alphanetworkcompiler</java.module.name>
+  </properties>
+
+  <dependencies>
+
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.drools</groupId>
+      <artifactId>drools-core</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.drools</groupId>
+      <artifactId>drools-mvel</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.drools</groupId>
+      <artifactId>drools-compiler</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.kie</groupId>
+      <artifactId>kie-api</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.kie</groupId>
+      <artifactId>kie-internal</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+
+
+    <!-- Logging -->
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
+      <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency><!-- For unit test logging: configure in src/test/resources/logback-test.xml -->
+      <groupId>ch.qos.logback</groupId>
+      <artifactId>logback-classic</artifactId>
+      <scope>test</scope>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.kie</groupId>
+      <artifactId>kie-test-util</artifactId>
+      <scope>test</scope>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.kie</groupId>
+      <artifactId>kie-memory-compiler</artifactId>
+      <scope>provided</scope>
+    </dependency>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.drools</groupId>
+      <artifactId>drools-model-compiler</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+  </dependencies>
+
+  <build>
+    <resources>
+      <resource>
+        <directory>src/main/resources</directory>
+      </resource>
+      <resource>
+        <filtering>true</filtering>
+        <directory>src/main/filtered-resources</directory>
+      </resource>
+    </resources>
+
+    <testResources>
+      <testResource>
+        <directory>src/test/resources</directory>
+        <filtering>false</filtering>
+      </testResource>
+      <testResource>
+        <directory>src/test/filtered-resources</directory>
+        <filtering>true</filtering>
+      </testResource>
+    </testResources>
+
+
+    <plugins>
+      <plugin>
+        <groupId>org.apache.felix</groupId>

timeline.bodyText: @lucamolteni for sure I'm missing something but it seems to me that this LOAD option is covering the case when the compiled alpha network is in the kjar so this could be actually replaced with COMPILE. Can you please clarify?
timeline.author: mariofusco

replies.bodyText:
when the drools-anc-compiler file exists, the option LOAD is set, so that the updater listeners doesn't have to depend on the full module
see https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/pull/3159/files#diff-947e341bb9ead75ab95767577467570b3a13c9068a09a4255e169050f21343d8R246
replies.author: lucamolteni

timeline.bodyText: It seems you're creating this variable but never using it.
timeline.author: mariofusco

timeline.message: ANC module compiling, but not created
CompiledNetwork is a ObjectSinkPropagator, threfore avoiding having a specific ObjectTypeNode for ANC
Example of injection of multiple services
Update only when using alpha network compiler
Moved ANC to RuleBaseConfiguration, default to disabled. InMemoryCompilation in KieContainerImpl

Revert "Moved ANC to RuleBaseConfiguration, default to disabled. InMemoryCompilation in KieContainerImpl"

This reverts commit a4685723
[DROOLS-4844] Alpha Network Compiler should be an option in Kie-API
Additional files generator for exec model
Experiment with new callbabck after writeProjectOutput with kiebase name

Revert "Experiment with new callbabck after writeProjectOutput with kiebase name"

This reverts commit 60864351
Abstract configuration from updater, read anc file to instantiate ANC from the kie-maven-plugin
Do not silently fail when class not found
Correct loading of ANC from Kjar, with unfortunately regeneration of source
Added tracing, changed package for generated compiled an
Added Jira to remember to get IndexableConstraint without generating the whole source code
Do not use Math.abs of hashcode
Avoid enque the updaters and run them directly
